organic_results.title: Faculty Behavior in the Legislative Process: Professorial Attitudes vs. Behavior Concerning Inclusion of Students in Academic Decision-Making
organic_results.snippet: This paper explores the voting behavior of the faculty of a major midwestern university throughout a sequence of reversed stands on the question of student participation in the university's structure. A questionnaire midway through the series of votes provided data on how individual faculty voted on three critical motions, how they thought other groups voted, and why changes took place. Analyses by academic rank and academic specialty revealed career differences and misperceptions. The factors of political leadership, open and closed …
